name: Masoor Dal
history: Masoor Dal, made from red lentils, is a staple dish in Indian cuisine. It is known for its quick cooking time and high nutritional value, making it a popular choice in many Indian households.
description: Masoor Dal is a simple yet flavorful lentil dish made with red lentils (masoor dal). It is typically seasoned with a variety of spices and herbs, offering a comforting and nutritious meal, often served with rice or roti.

instructions.title: Cook the Lentils
instructions.description: Rinse the masoor dal thoroughly. In a pan, add dal, turmeric powder, and 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the dal is soft and cooked.

instructions.title: Prepare the Tadka
instructions.description: Heat oil in another pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter. Add ginger-garlic paste and onions, and sautÃ© until golden brown. Add chopped tomatoes, red chili powder, and salt. Cook until tomatoes are soft.

instructions.title: Combine Dal with Tadka
instructions.description: Pour the cooked tomato-onion tadka into the cooked dal. Add garam masala and mix well. Simmer for 5-10 minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread like roti or naan.

tips: Soaking the dal before cooking can reduce cooking time.
Adjust the amount of red chili powder according to your spice preference.
variations: Add vegetables like spinach or carrots for extra nutrition.
For a smoky flavor, add a tadka of cumin seeds and red chilies in ghee.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 2 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving bowl.
Pair with a side of cooling cucumber raita.
